Slow and Steady.description: Duergar have a base speed of 20 feet, but their speed is never modified by armor or encumbrance.

Superior Darkvision.name: Superior Darkvision
Superior Darkvision.description: Duergar can see in the dark up to 120 feet.

Duergar Immunities.name: Duergar Immunities
Duergar Immunities.description: Duergar are immune to paralysis, phantasms, and poison. They gain a +2 racial bonus on saves against spells and spell-like abilities.

Stability.name: Stability
Stability.description: Duergar receive a +4 racial bonus to their CMD against bull rush or trip attempts while on solid ground.

Spell-Like Abilities.name: Spell-Like Abilities
Spell-Like Abilities.description: A duergar can use enlarge person and invisibility once each per day, using its character level as its caster level and affecting itself only.

Light Sensitivity.name: Light Sensitivity
Light Sensitivity.description: Duergar are dazzled in areas of bright light.

Gillman.name: Gillman
Gillman.description: Survivors of a land-dwelling culture whose homeland was destroyed, gillmen were saved and transformed into an amphibious race by the aboleths. Though in many ways they appear nearly human, gillmen's bright purple eyes and gills set them apart from humanity. Reclusive and suspicious, gillmen know that one day the aboleths will call in the debt owed to them.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Gillmen are vigorous and beautiful, but their domination by the aboleths has made them weak-willed.

Medium.name: Medium
Medium.description: Gillmen are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

Aquatic.name: Aquatic
Aquatic.description: Gillmen are humanoids with the aquatic subtype.

Normal Speed.name: Normal Speed
Normal Speed.description: Gillmen have a base speed of 30 feet on land. As aquatic creatures, they also have a swim speed of 30 feet, can move in water without making Swim checks, and always treat Swim as a class skill.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: Gillmen have the aquatic subtype, but can breathe both water and air.

Enchantment Resistance.name: Enchantment Resistance
Enchantment Resistance.description: Gillmen gain a +2 racial saving throw bonus against non-aboleth enchantment spells and effects, but take a 2 penalty on such saving throws against aboleth sources.

Water Dependent.name: Water Dependent
Water Dependent.description: A gillman's body requires constant submersion in fresh or salt water. Gillmen who spend more than 1 day without fully submerging themselves in water risk internal organ failure, painful cracking of the skin, and death within 4d6 hours.

Grippli.name: Grippli
Grippli.description: Furtive frogfolk with the ability to camouflage themselves among fens and swamps, gripplis typically keep to their wetland homes, only rarely interacting with the outside world. Their chief motivation for leaving their marshy environs is to trade in metal and gems.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Gripplis are nimble and alert, but spindly.

Small.name: Small
Small.description: Gripplis are Small creatures and gain a +1 size bonus to their AC, a +1 size bonus on attack rolls, a 1 penalty to their CMB and CMD, and a +4 size bonus on Stealth checks.

Grippli.name: Grippli
Grippli.description: Gripplis are humanoids with the grippli subtype.

Normal Speed.name: Normal Speed
Normal Speed.description: Gripplis have a base speed of 30 feet and a climb speed of 20 feet.

Darkvision.name: Darkvision
Darkvision.description: Gripplis can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: Gripplis receive a +4 racial bonus on Stealth checks in marshes and forested areas.

Swamp Stride (Ex).name: Swamp Stride (Ex)
Swamp Stride (Ex).description: A grippli can move through difficult terrain at its normal speed while within a swamp. Magically altered terrain affects a grippli normally.

Kitsune.name: Kitsune
Kitsune.description: These shapeshifting, foxlike folk share a love of mischief, art, and the finer things in life. They can appear as a single human as well as their true form, that of a foxlike humanoid. Kitsune are quick-witted, nimble, and gregarious, and because of this, a fair number of them become adventurers.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Kitsune are agile and companionable, but tend to be physically weak.

Medium.name: Medium
Medium.description: Kitsune are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

Kitsune.name: Kitsune
Kitsune.description: Kitsune are humanoids with the kitsune and shapechanger subtypes.

Normal Speed.name: Normal Speed
Normal Speed.description: Kitsune have a base speed of 30 feet.

Low-Light Vision (Ex).description: Kitsune can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.

Change Shape (Su).name: Change Shape (Su)
Change Shape (Su).description: A kitsune can assume the appearance of a specific single human form of the same sex. The kitsune always takes this specific form when she uses this ability. A kitsune in human form cannot use her bite attack, but gains a +10 racial bonus on Disguise checks made to appear human. Changing shape is a standard action. This ability otherwise functions as alter self, except that the kitsune does not adjust her ability scores.

Agile (Ex).name: Agile (Ex)
Agile (Ex).description: Kitsune receive a +2 racial bonus on Acrobatics checks.

Kitsune Magic (Ex\/Sp).name: Kitsune Magic (Ex/Sp)
Kitsune Magic (Ex\/Sp).description: Kitsune add +1 to the DC of any saving throws against enchantment spells that they cast. Kitsune with a Charisma score of 11 or higher gain the following spell-like ability: 3/daydancing lights.

Natural Weapons (Ex).name: Natural Weapons (Ex)
Natural Weapons (Ex).description: In her natural form, a kitsune has a bite attack that deals 1d4 points of damage.

Merfolk.name: Merfolk
Merfolk.description: These creatures have the upper torso of a well-built and attractive humanoid and a lower half consisting of a finned tail. Though they are amphibious and extremely strong swimmers, their lower bodies make it difficult for them to move on land. Merfolk can be shy and reclusive. Typically keeping to themselves, they are distrustful of land-dwelling strangers.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Merfolk are graceful, hale, and beautiful.

Medium.name: Medium
Medium.description: Merfolk are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

Slow Speed.name: Slow Speed
Slow Speed.description: Merfolk have a base speed of 5 feet. They have a swim speed of 50 feet.

Aquatic.name: Aquatic
Aquatic.description: Merfolk are humanoids with the aquatic subtype.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: Merfolk are amphibious, but prefer not to spend long periods out of the water.

Armor.name: Armor
Armor.description: Merfolk have a +2 natural armor bonus.

Legless.name: Legless
Legless.description: Merfolk have no legs, and cannot be tripped.

Nagaji.name: Nagaji
Nagaji.description: It is believed that nagas created the nagaji as a race of servants and that the nagaji worship their creators as living gods. Due to their reptilian nature and strange mannerisms, these strange, scaly folk inspire fear and wonder in others not of their kind. They are resistant to both poison and mind-affecting magic.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Nagaji are strong and have forceful personalities, but tend to ignore logic and mock scholastic pursuits.

Medium.name: Medium
Medium.description: Nagaji are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

Reptilian.name: Reptilian
Reptilian.description: Nagaji are humanoids with the reptilian subtype.

Normal Speed.name: Normal Speed
Normal Speed.description: Nagaji have a base speed of 30 feet.

Low-Light Vision.name: Low-Light Vision
Low-Light Vision.description: Nagaji can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.

Armored Scales.name: Armored Scales
Armored Scales.description: Nagaji have a +1 natural armor bonus from their scaly flesh.

Resistant (Ex).name: Resistant (Ex)
Resistant (Ex).description: Nagaji receive a +2 racial saving throw bonus against mind-affecting effects and poison.

Serpent's Sense (Ex).name: Serpent's Sense (Ex)
Serpent's Sense (Ex).description: Nagaji receive a +2 racial bonus on Handle Animal checks against reptiles, and a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks.

Samsaran.name: Samsaran
Samsaran.description: Ghostly servants of karma, samsarans are creatures reincarnated hundreds if not thousands of times in the hope of reaching true enlightenment. Unlike humans and other races, these humanoids remember much of their past lives.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Samsarans are insightful and strong-minded, but their bodies tend to be frail.

Medium.name: Medium
Medium.description: Samsarans are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

Normal Speed.name: Normal Speed
Normal Speed.description: Samsarans have a base speed of 30 feet.

Low-Light Vision (Ex).name: Low-Light Vision (Ex)
Low-Light Vision (Ex).description: Samsarans can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.

Lifebound (Ex).name: Lifebound (Ex)
Lifebound (Ex).description: Samsarans gain a +2 racial bonus on all saving throws made to resist death effects, saving throws against negative energy effects, Fortitude saves made to remove negative levels, and Constitution checks made to stabilize if reduced to negative hit points.

Samsaran Magic (Sp).name: Samsaran Magic (Sp)
Samsaran Magic (Sp).description: Samsarans with a Charisma score of 11 or higher gain the following spell-like abilities: 1/daycomprehend languages, deathwatch, and stabilize. The caster level for these effects is equal to the samsaran's level.

Shards of the Past (Ex).name: Shards of the Past (Ex)
Shards of the Past (Ex).description: A samsaran's past lives grant her bonuses on two particular skills. A samsaran chooses two skillsshe gains a +2 racial bonus on both of these skills, and they are treated as class skills regardless of what class she actually takes.

Strix.name: Strix
Strix.description: Hunted to dwindling numbers by humans, who see them as winged devils, strix are black-skinned masters of the nighttime sky. Their territorial conflicts have fueled their hatred for humans. This longstanding feud means that these nocturnal creatures often attack humans on sight.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Strix are swift and elusive, but tend to be stubborn and swift to anger.

Strix.name: Strix
Strix.description: Strix are humanoids with the strix subtype.

Medium.name: Medium
Medium.description: Strix are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

Normal Speed.name: Normal Speed
Normal Speed.description: Strix have a base speed of 30 feet on land. They also have a fly speed of 60 feet (average).

Low-Light Vision.name: Low-Light Vision
Low-Light Vision.description: Strix can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.

Darkvision.name: Darkvision
Darkvision.description: Strix can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Hatred.name: Hatred
Hatred.description: Strix receive a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures with the human subtype because of their special training against these hated foes.

Nocturnal.name: Nocturnal
Nocturnal.description: Strix gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception and Stealth checks in dim light or darkness.

Suspicious.name: Suspicious
Suspicious.description: Strix receive a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against illusion spells and effects.

Suli.name: Suli
Suli.description: Also called suli-jann, these humanoids are the descendants of mortals and jann. These strong and charismatic individuals manifest mastery over elemental power in their adolescence, giving them the ability to manipulate earth, fire, ice, or electricity. This elemental power tends to be reflected in the suli's personality as well.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Sulis are brawny and charming, but slow-witted.

Native Outsider.name: Native Outsider
Native Outsider.description: Sulis are outsiders with the native subtype.

Medium.name: Medium
Medium.description: Sulis are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

Normal Speed.name: Normal Speed
Normal Speed.description: Sulis have a base speed of 30 feet.

Low-Light Vision.name: Low-Light Vision
Low-Light Vision.description: Sulis can see twice as far as humans in dim light.

Negotiator.name: Negotiator
Negotiator.description: Sulis are keen negotiators, and gain a +2 racial bonus on Diplomacy and Sense Motive checks.

Elemental Assault (Su).name: Elemental Assault (Su)
Elemental Assault (Su).description: Once per day as a swift action, a suli can shroud her arms in acid, cold, electricity, or fire. This lasts for one round per level, and can be dismissed as a free action. Unarmed strikes with her arms or hands (or attacks with weapons held in those hands) deal +1d6 points of damage of the appropriate energy type.

Energy Resistance 5.name: Energy Resistance 5
Energy Resistance 5.description: Sulis have resistance to acid 5, cold 5, electricity 5, and fire 5.

Languages.name: Languages
default: one elemental language (Aquan, Auran, Ignan, or Terran)

Svirfneblin.name: Svirfneblin
Svirfneblin.description: Gnomes who guard their hidden enclaves within dark tunnels and caverns deep under the earth, svirfneblin are as serious as their surface cousins are whimsical. They are resistant to the magic of the foul creatures that share their subterranean environs, and wield powerful protective magic. Svirfneblin are distrustful of outsiders and often hide at their approach.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Svirfneblin are fast and observant but relatively weak and emotionally distant.

Gnome.name: Gnome
Gnome.description: Svirfneblin are humanoids with the gnome subtype.

Small.name: Small
Small.description: Svirfneblin are Small creatures and gain a +1 size bonus to their AC, a +1 size bonus on attack rolls, a 1 penalty to their CMB and CMD, and a +4 size bonus on Stealth checks.

Defensive Training.name: Defensive Training
Defensive Training.description: Svirfneblin gain a +2 dodge bonus to Armor Class.

Senses.name: Senses
Senses.description: Svirfneblin have darkvision 120 ft. and low-light vision.

Fortunate.name: Fortunate
Fortunate.description: Svirfneblin gain a +2 racial bonus on all saving throws.

Skilled.name: Skilled
Skilled.description: Svirfneblin gain a +2 racial bonus on Stealth checks; this improves to a +4 bonus underground. They gain a +2 racial bonus on Craft (alchemy) checks and Perception checks.

Hatred.name: Hatred
Hatred.description: Svirfneblin receive a +1 bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures of the reptilian and dwarven subtypes due to training against these hated foes.

Spell Resistance.name: Spell Resistance
Spell Resistance.description: Svirfneblin have SR equal to 11 + their class levels.

Svirfneblin Magic.name: Svirfneblin Magic
Svirfneblin Magic.description: Svirfneblin add +1 to the DC of any illusion spells they cast. Svirfneblin also gain the following spell-like abilities: Constantnondetection; 1/dayblindness/deafness, blur, disguise self; caster level equals the svirfneblin's class levels.

Vanara.name: Vanara
Vanara.description: These mischievous, monkeylike humanoids dwell in jungles and warm forests. Covered in soft fur and sporting prehensile tails and handlike feet, vanaras are strong climbers. These creatures are at home both on the ground and among the treetops.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Vanaras are agile and insightful, but are also rather mischievous.

Vanara.name: Vanara
Vanara.description: Vanaras are humanoids with the vanara subtype.

Medium.name: Medium
Medium.description: Vanaras are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

Normal Speed.name: Normal Speed
Normal Speed.description: Vanaras have a base speed of 30 feet and a Climb speed of 30 feet.

Low-Light Vision.name: Low-Light Vision
Low-Light Vision.description: A vanara can see twice as far as a human in dim light.

Nimble.name: Nimble
Nimble.description: Vanaras have a +2 racial bonus on Acrobatics and Stealth checks.

Prehensile Tail.name: Prehensile Tail
Prehensile Tail.description: A vanara has a long, flexible tail that she can use to carry objects. She cannot wield weapons with her tail, but the tail allows her to retrieve a small, stowed object carried on her person as a swift action.

Vishkanya.name: Vishkanya
Vishkanya.description: Strangely beautiful on the outside and poisonous on the inside, vishkanyas see the world through slitted serpent eyes. Vishkanyas possess a serpent's grace and ability to writhe out of their enemies' grasp with ease. Vishkanyas have a reputation for being both seductive and manipulative. They can use their saliva or blood to poison their weapons.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Vishkanyas are graceful and elegant, but they are often irrational.

Vishkanya.name: Vishkanya
Vishkanya.description: Vishkanyas are humanoids with the vishkanya subtype.

Medium.name: Medium
Medium.description: Vishkanyas are Medium creatures and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.

Normal Speed.name: Normal Speed
Normal Speed.description: Vishkanyas have a base speed of 30 feet.

Low-Light Vision.name: Low-Light Vision
Low-Light Vision.description: Vishkanyas can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.

Keen Senses.name: Keen Senses
Keen Senses.description: Vishkanyas receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks.

Limber.name: Limber
Limber.description: Vishkanyas receive a +2 racial bonus on Escape Artist and Stealth checks.

Poison Resistance.name: Poison Resistance
Poison Resistance.description: A vishkanya has a racial bonus on saving throws against poison equal to its Hit Dice.

Poison Use.name: Poison Use
Poison Use.description: Vishkanyas are skilled in the use of poison and never accidentally poison themselves when using or applying poison.

Toxic.name: Toxic
Toxic.description: A number of times per day equal to his Constitution modifier (minimum 1/day), a vishkanya can envenom a weapon that he wields with his toxic saliva or blood (using blood requires the vishkanya to be injured when he uses this ability). Applying venom in this way is a swift action.

ability.name: Vishkanya Venom
ability.description: Injury; save Fort DC 10 + 1/2 the vishkanya's Hit Dice + the vishkanya's Constitution modifier; frequency 1/round for 6 rounds; effect 1d2 Dex; cure 1 save.

Weapon Familiarity.name: Weapon Familiarity
Weapon Familiarity.description: Vishkanyas are always proficient with blowguns, kukri, and shuriken.

Wayang.name: Wayang
Wayang.description: The small wayangs are creatures of the Plane of Shadow. They are so attuned to shadow that it even shapes their philosophy, believing that upon death they merely merge back into darkness. The mysteries of their shadowy existence grant them the ability to gain healing from negative energy as well as positive energy.

Ability Modifiers.name: Ability Modifiers
Ability Modifiers.description: Wayang are nimble and cagey, but their perception of the world is clouded by shadows.

Wayang.name: Wayang
Wayang.description: Wayangs are humanoids with the wayang subtype.

Small.name: Small
Small.description: Wayangs are Small creatures and gain a +1 size bonus to their AC, a +1 size bonus on attack rolls, a 1 penalty on their CMB and to CMD, and a +4 size bonus on Stealth checks.

Slow Speed.name: Slow Speed
Slow Speed.description: Wayangs have a base speed of 20 feet.

Darkvision.name: Darkvision
Darkvision.description: Wayangs can see in the dark up to 60 feet.

Light and Dark (Su).name: Light and Dark (Su)
Light and Dark (Su).description: Once per day as an immediate action, a wayang can treat positive and negative energy effects as if she were an undead creature, taking damage from positive energy and healing damage from negative energy. This ability lasts for 1 minute once activated.

Lurker.name: Lurker
Lurker.description: Wayangs gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception and Stealth checks.

Shadow Magic.name: Shadow Magic
Shadow Magic.description: Wayangs add +1 to the DC of any saving throws against spells of the shadow subschool that they cast. Wayangs with a Charisma score of 11 or higher also gain the following spell-like abilities: 1/dayghost sound, pass without trace, and ventriloquism. The caster level for these effects is equal to the wayang's level. The DC for these spells is equal to 10 + the spell's level + the wayang's Charisma modifier.

Shadow Resistance.name: Shadow Resistance
Shadow Resistance.description: Wayangs get a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against spells of the shadow subschool.

Dissolution's Child.name: Dissolution's Child
Dissolution's Child.description: Once per day, you may change your appearance to look as if you were little more than a 4-foot-tall area of shadow. Your physical form still exists and you are not incorporealonly your appearance changes. This works like invisibility, except it only lasts 1 round per level (maximum 5 rounds). This is a supernatural ability.
